subject: Law
title: Rawls and the Veil of Ignorance
description: A quick, practical guide to Rawls and the Veil of Ignorance.

hook.text: Design a society without knowing your place in itâ€”rich or poor, healthy or sick. What rules would you choose?

buildup.text: John Rawls proposed the 'veil of ignorance': just rules are those chosen without knowing your own position.

discovery.text: Behind the veil, Rawls argued people would choose equal basic liberties and help for the worst-off members.

twist.text: His 'difference principle' permits inequality only if it benefits the least advantaged. Pure equality isn't required.

climax.text: Rawls shaped debates on healthcare, taxation, and welfareâ€”any policy about distributing society's resources.

punchline.text: Would you accept the rules not knowing your place? That's the test.

quiz.question: What is Rawls' 'veil of ignorance'?
options: Choosing rules without knowing your position in society
